member.name: T:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.WindowShowCommand
member.summary: Flags controlling the appearance of a window.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.WindowShowCommand.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.summary: Activates and displays the window (including restoring it to its original size and position).

member.summary: Minimizes the window.

member.summary: Maximizes the window.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.WindowShowCommand.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Similar to , except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.WindowShowCommand.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.WindowShowCommand.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the window and activates the next top-level window.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.WindowShowCommand.ShowMinimizedNoActivate
member.summary: Minimizes the window and does not activate it.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.WindowShowCommand.ShowNA
member.summary: Similar to , except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.WindowShowCommand.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window, restoring it to its original size and position.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.WindowShowCommand.Default
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the initial value specified when the process was created.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.WindowShowCommand.ForceMinimize
member.summary: Minimizes a window, even if the thread owning the window is not responding. Use this only to minimize windows from a different thread.

member.summary: Gets the current process' explicit application user model id.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.Windows7Taskbar.EnableCustomWindowPreview(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Indicates that the specified window requests the DWM to demand live preview (thumbnail and peek) mode when necessary instead of relying on default preview.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.Windows7Taskbar.DisableCustomWindowPreview(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Indicates that the specified window does not require the DWM to demand live preview (thumbnail and peek) mode when necessary, i.e. this window relies on default preview.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.Windows7Taskbar.SetIconicThumbnail(System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Sets the specified iconic thumbnail for the specified window. This is typically done in response to a DWM message.

member.summary: Sets the specified peek (live preview) bitmap for the specified window. This is typically done in response to a DWM message.
member.param: Whether to display a standard window frame around the bitmap.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.Windows7Taskbar.SetPeekBitmap(System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Point,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the specified peek (live preview) bitmap for the specified window. This is typically done in response to a DWM message.
member.param: The client area offset at which to display the specified bitmap. The rest of the parent window will be displayed as "remembered" by the DWM.
Whether to display a standard window frame around the bitmap.

member.summary: Draws the specified overlay icon on the specified window's taskbar button.

member.summary: Specifies that the taskbar- and DWM-related windows messages should pass through the Windows UIPI mechanism even if the process is running elevated. Calling this method is not required unless the process is running elevated.

member.summary: No progress is displayed.

member.name: T:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager
member.summary: Provides services to manage taskbar jump lists, including custom destinations and custom tasks.
member.remarks: This class mostly borrows the Windows Shell's concepts where jump lists are concerned including: Application destinations - Destinations added to the application's recent and frequent categories by the shell or by the application. Custom destinations - Destinations added to the application's jump list in other categories by the application. Tasks - Tasks added to the application's jump list. The methods of this class are not thread-safe.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the jump list manager with the specified application id.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the jump list manager with the specified window handle.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.AddUserTask(Windows7.DesktopIntegration.IJumpListTask)
member.summary: Adds a task to the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.DeleteTask(Windows7.DesktopIntegration.IJumpListTask)
member.summary: Deletes the specified task from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.ClearTasks
member.summary: Deletes all the tasks from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.AddCustomDestination(Windows7.DesktopIntegration.IJumpListDestination)
member.summary: Adds a custom destination to the application's jump list.
member.param: An object implementing such as or .

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.GetCustomDestinationsByCategory(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the custom destinations belonging to the specified category from this application's jump list. If destinations are modified through the use of this property, the method must be called to repopulate the application's jump list.
member.returns: A collection of destinations of type .

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.DeleteCustomDestination(Windows7.DesktopIntegration.IJumpListDestination)
member.summary: Deletes the specified custom destination from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.AddToRecent(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified destination to the application's recent destinations list.
member.remarks: If the recent and frequent categories are disabled, this method has no visual effect on the jump list in the recent and frequent categories respectively.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.AddToRecent(Windows7.DesktopIntegration.IJumpListDestination)
member.summary: Adds the specified destination to the application's recent destinations list.
member.remarks: If the recent and frequent categories are disabled, this method has no visual effect on the jump list in the recent and frequent categories respectively.
member.param: An object implementing such as or .

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.ClearAllDestinations
member.summary: Removes all destinations from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.ClearApplicationDestinations
member.summary: Removes all application destinations (such as frequent and recent) from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.GetApplicationDestinations(Windows7.DesktopIntegration.ApplicationDestinationType)
member.summary: Retrieves all application destinations belonging to the specified application destination type.
member.returns: A copy of the application destinations belonging to the specified type; modifying the returned objects has no effect on the application's destination list.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.DeleteApplicationDestination(Windows7.DesktopIntegration.IJumpListDestination)
member.summary: Deletes the specified application destination from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.ClearCustomDestinations
member.summary: Deletes all custom destinations from the application's jump list.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.Refresh
member.summary: Repopulates the application's jump list. Use this method after all current changes to the application's jump list have been introduced, and you want the list to be refreshed.
member.returns: true if the list was refreshed; false if the operation was cancelled. The operation might have been cancelled if the event handler instructed us to cancel the operation.
member.remarks: If the user removed items from the jump list between the last refresh operation and this one, then the event will be invoked. If the event handler for this event instructed us to cancel the operation, then the current transaction is aborted, no items are added, and this method returns false. Check the return value to determine whether the jump list needs to be changed and the operation attempted again.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.Dispose
member.summary: Cleans the resources associated with this jump list.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.Tasks
member.summary: Retrieves the tasks currently present in the application's jump list. If the tasks are modified through the use of this property, the method must be called to repopulate the application's jump list.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.CustomDestinationCategories
member.summary: Retrieves all custom destination categories in this application's jump list.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.EnabledAutoDestinationType
member.summary: The currently enabled automatic application destination type. The supported values are the values of the enumeration. Only of the values can be set at any given time.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.MaximumSlotsInList
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of items to be placed in the application's jump list. This number depends on factors such as the display resolution or monitor change - do not assume it is always constant.

member.name: E:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.JumpListManager.UserRemovedItems
member.summary: Register to this event to receive notifications when custom destinations are being removed from your jump list by the user. If you do not register to this event, you will not be able to refresh the list. Additionally, if you attempt to add items to the list which have been previously removed by the user, the next refresh will fail to add your category.

member.name: T:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.ApplicationDestinationType
member.summary: The application destination type.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.ApplicationDestinationType.NONE
member.summary: No application destination type is selected.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.ApplicationDestinationType.Recent
member.summary: Destinations used recently.

member.name: F:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.ApplicationDestinationType.Frequent
member.summary: Destinations used frequently.

member.name: T:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.UserRemovedItemsEventArgs
member.summary: The event arguments for the event that occurs when the user removes items from the application's jump list.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.UserRemovedItemsEventArgs.RemovedItems
member.summary: The collection of removed items. Each item is the path.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.UserRemovedItemsEventArgs.CancelCurrentOperation
member.summary: Set to true if the current operation should be cancelled. Should be used by the application if because of the items the user has removed there is no real work to do with the jump list.

member.name: T:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.BitmapRequestedEventArgs
member.summary: The event arguments object for the thumbnail request and peek preview request events published by the class.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.BitmapRequestedEventArgs.Width
member.summary: Gets the requested bitmap's width.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.BitmapRequestedEventArgs.Height
member.summary: Gets the requested bitmap's height.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.BitmapRequestedEventArgs.UseWindowScreenshot
member.summary: Sets a flag indicating whether to use the window screenshot instead of specifying a bitmap. Note that using this feature is risky because not always a window screenshot can easily be snapped. For example, minimized windows do not ever draw and therefore a bitmap of them can't be taken.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.BitmapRequestedEventArgs.DoNotMirrorBitmap
member.summary: Specifies whether the provided bitmap is already mirrored. DWM thumbnail and peek bitmaps must be mirrored vertically. If this flag is set to false, the will mirror the bitmap automatically.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.BitmapRequestedEventArgs.DisplayFrameAroundBitmap
member.summary: Specifies whether a standard window frame will be displayed around the bitmap. If the bitmap represents a top-level window, you would probably set this flag to true. If the bitmap represents a child window (or a frameless window), you would probably set this flag to false.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.BitmapRequestedEventArgs.Bitmap
member.summary: Sets the bitmap requested by the sender. If the bitmap doesn't have the right dimensions, the DWM may scale it or not render certain areas as appropriate - it is the user's responsibility to render a bitmap with the proper dimensions.

member.name: T:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.CustomWindowsManager
member.summary: Manages custom window representations in taskbar thumbnails and DWM peek preview (Aero Peek).

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.CustomWindowsManager.CreateWindowsManager(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class from the specified window handle.
member.returns: A new instance of this class wrapping the specified window handle.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.CustomWindowsManager.CreateWindowsManager(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class from the specified window handle and parent window handle.
member.returns: A new instance of this class wrapping the specified window handle and parent window handle.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.CustomWindowsManager.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class using the specified window handle and enables custom window preview on the window.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.CustomWindowsManager.InvalidatePreviews
member.summary: Invalidates the previews (thumbnail bitmap and peek bitmap) that the DWM has currently cached. If this method is not called, the DWM is free to use old versions of the bitmaps.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.CustomWindowsManager.DisablePreview
member.summary: Disables window preview features for this window.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.CustomWindowsManager.EnablePreview
member.summary: Enables window preview features for this window. Window preview feature are enabled by default, unless disabled by the use of the method.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.CustomWindowsManager.WindowClosed
member.summary: Notifies the custom window manager that the underlying window has been closed. This method must be called when the window is closed, or residual buttons might remain in the taskbar and window handle leaks might occur.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.CustomWindowsManager.DispatchMessage(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Dispatches a window message so that the appropriate events can be invoked.
member.param: The window message, typically obtained from a Windows Forms or WPF window procedure.

member.name: E:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.CustomWindowsManager.PeekRequested
member.summary: The event that occurs when a peek bitmap must be provided for the window.

member.name: E:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.CustomWindowsManager.ThumbnailRequested
member.summary: The event that occurs when a thumbnail must be provided for the window.

member.name: T:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.ScreenCapture
member.summary: Contains utility methods associated with screen capturing.

member.name: M:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.ScreenCapture.GrabWindowBitmap(System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Captures a screenshot of the specified window at the specified bitmap size.
member.returns: A screen capture of the window.

member.name: T:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.Properties.Resources
member.summary: Eine stark typisierte Ressourcenklasse zum Suchen von lokalisierten Zeichenfolgen usw.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Gibt die zwischengespeicherte ResourceManager-Instanz zurck, die von dieser Klasse verwendet wird.

member.name: P:Windows7.DesktopIntegration.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: berschreibt die CurrentUICulture-Eigenschaft des aktuellen Threads fr alle Ressourcenzuordnungen, die diese stark typisierte Ressourcenklasse verwenden.
